turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: ...She fixes him pork chops and rice, the next thing you know they're making love on the sofa.  She says he was very gentle.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I spoke to her.  The guy told her he missed his little girl and she felt sorry for him.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: That's how you score now?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: The woman also said he stole her husband's gun, a twenty-two pistol, and some of his clothes.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: So the woman's married.  She goes to bed with this prison escapee because he misses his little girl and then tells the world about it.  But you don't reveal her name, you protect her.  It sounds like you're saying it's okay as long as her husband doesn't find out about it.  Like the guy who cheats on his wife, saying what she doesn't know won't hurt her.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Thank you...

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Not so fast, Dick.  Starting now, there's gonna be an across the board cost a living increase.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Year ago, I come in here on credit card fraud, but after I shanked that loudmouth pussy on the yard the other day, my Dunn & Broadstreet, has gone way the fuck up.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: I think it's Dunn & <u>Brad</u>street.  But then, I could be wrong...

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Whoever.  The point is, prices are goin' up, too.  Better get your little black book out, Richard.  We got some business to talk about.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: That Bausch & Lomb Saline shit you asked for is gonna be eighty bucks.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Well, I need that...

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: ...and that extra pillow's gonna be an even three c's.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Faux goose down.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Still...

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Excuse me.  Snoopy?  Did we settle the fish thing?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Yeah.  Sure.  It's all settled.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Well, if it isn't the Ripper hisself.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Are those my suits?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Where you been hiding, Dick?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Midge.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Forget about her.  Tell me where the money's at.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Foley's got it.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Where the fuck is Foley?

turns.speaker: WHITE BOY BOB
turns.text: We have a problem here?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Jack Foley, famous bank robber.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: White Boy, how much is the reward on the man again?

turns.speaker: WHITE BOY BOB
turns.text: Ten gees.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Uh-huh.  You recall, did it say dead or alive?

turns.speaker: WHITE BOY BOB
turns.text: I think he must've fell in.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: I sent these two looking for him, they come back shaking their heads.

turns.speaker: WHITE BOY BOB
turns.text: I found a rubber.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: White Boy, the man's not gonna hide no diamonds under the fuckin' mattress.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: ...the fuck is this...

turns.speaker: WHITE BOY BOB
turns.text: Are they dead?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: You good-lookin' sumbitch...don't you EVER die!

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: That's your line for tonight, ya know.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What, good-lookin' sumbitch?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: No, numbnuts, die.  You get your nurse alone, you look her in the eye, and say, "Baby, they're training me for war, and I don't know what'll happen.  But if I die tomorrow, I wanna know that we lived all we could tonight."  I've never known it to fail.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Are you sure they're here?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: If Evelyn's here, the rest are here!

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: What is it with Red?  I've never seen him this way.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: He's been like that all day.  Hey Danny, you coming?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Do you have trouble with your boobs in the uniform?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: You mean hiding them?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Hide them?  On a date with pilots?  I'm talking about how you make them show!

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: We'll ask Evelyn.  Evelyn?  Evelyn!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Ooo, she's thinking of her date!  Come on, you've been dating a pilot.  We want to know what we can expect.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Now listen, it's hands off Billy.  I mean, you can put your hands on him if you want to, but then my hands will break yours.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: He was that good?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: No, I was.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I wish she could forget him.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: You don't forget love, Honey.  Not ever.

turns.speaker: RED
turns.text: He, I'm R-Red.  Red S-Strange.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Red...Strange?

turns.speaker: RED
turns.text: You know the football player, Red G- Grange?  Well the guys called me R-Red, cause you know, I'm red...and they thought I was strange, so, you know, Red G-Grange, Red Str-Strange.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: But...they called you Strange?  Because of Red Grange?  I don't get it.  Was Red Grange strange?

turns.speaker: RED
turns.text: How would I know.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Do you always stutter?

turns.speaker: RED
turns.text: Only when I'm n-n-n-

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Nervous?

turns.speaker: RED
turns.text: Yeah.  But if I have to get something out, I c-can always s-s-s-  SIIING!

turns.speaker: BRITISH AIR COMMANDER
turns.text: On loan from Colonel Doolittle, is it?

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: That's me, Sir.

turns.speaker: BRITISH AIR COMMANDER
turns.text: Good on you, then, Rafe McCawley.  We'll get you situated in some quarters, and then introduce you to the equipment you'll be flying.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: If you're patching up bullet holes right here on the runway, maybe we should skip the housekeeping and get right to the planes.

turns.speaker: BRITISH AIR COMMANDER
turns.text: Are all the Yanks as anxious as you are to get yourself killed, Lieutenant?

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Not anxious to die, Sir, anxious to matter.

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: You're Walker, right?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yes Sir.

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: That was a nice little stunt you pulled, buzzing the base.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You liked that?

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: Oh yeah.  I liked it so much I'm cutting you out of the squadron.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Sir?

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: I don't buy that hot dog shit.  So you and your buddies are gonna transfer your planes up to Haleiwa.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Hale-what?

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: You'll love it.  No base, no bars, just lots of sun and aircraft maintenance.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Sir, I --

turns.speaker: COLONEL
turns.text: Too late for apologies, Walker.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I wasn't gonna apologize, Sir.  I was just gonna say it was worth it to feel like a real pilot again, even if it was only for five seconds.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Hey.  You.  Mr. Coma.

turns.speaker: COMA
turns.text: Where's that lizard?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What lizard?

turns.speaker: COMA
turns.text: The one that slept in my mouth last night.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What the hell happened to you guys?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: COMA
turns.text: Mai-tai's.  I got this to tell ya, about mai-tai's.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Rafe's girl, Evelyn?

turns.speaker: COMA
turns.text: You guys know her?!  I gotta have an intro!  Man, I'd like to --

turns.speaker: COMA
turns.text: Ever hear of mai-tai's?  Comes in a big...pot.  Like...like...

turns.speaker: RED
turns.text: A m-missionary?

turns.speaker: COMA
turns.text: No, like...

turns.speaker: RED
turns.text: I th-think I'm gonna like it here.

turns.speaker: COMA
turns.text: You guys are new?

turns.speaker: COMA
turns.text: Shit, he's puking on my feet!

turns.speaker: RED
turns.text: Well, you p-puked on his feet.

turns.speaker: COMA
turns.text: Yeah, but he was wearing shoes!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: They ready, Earl?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: They'll all fly, but -- oh, shit...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Cock-suckin' right I do!!  In the gun lockers!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You guys get those!  Earl, Rafe, come with me!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Earl!  You said the planes were ready but -- but what?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Of the four left, only one is full of fuel.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Danny, I don't like this fuckin' guy.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Anthony, Red, stay with the guns!  Coma, you cover the cannons!  Joe, Theo, come with us!  Earl, you get on the radio! We're gonna fight these fuckers.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Who the fuck taught you to fly?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: He did.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Bandits at 2 o'clock.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Power dive!

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: It's Germans!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Kill the bastards!

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Good shooting, Danny!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Good shooting, Rafe!

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Land of the free...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Home of the brave!

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: There's another one!

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Didn't you say test the limits?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Hey, you wanna test my limits, you better line up a couple dozen women on the GROUND...cause I got NO limits in the air!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: How could you do this?

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: The Colonel helped me work it out.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I don't mean how'd you do the paperwork, I mean how the hell did you do it without letting me in on it?

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: I'm sorry, Danny, but they're only accepting the best pilots.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Don't make this a joke, Rafe.  You're talking about war, and I know what war does to people.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Danny, you know how many times I saw you come to school with a black eye or a busted nose, and couldn't do a thing about it -- for you, or for your mother... or your father, with his lungs scorched out with mustard gas, and more left of his lungs than there was of his spirit? You've made your sacrifice, Danny.  It's time I made mine.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Nah, you go on.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: I have to talk to Evelyn.  And I want you to meet her.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Some other time.  I don't feel like a party.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Didn't you say you told her not to come?

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Then why are you looking for her?

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: It's a test.  If I asked her to come and she came, it wouldn't tell me anything. If I tell her not to come, and she comes...then I know she loves me.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You'd always go sit in a plane whenever you were upset.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Upset?  Why should I be upset?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Let's go get a drink.  Unless you're scared to talk about it.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Why be sorry?  That's what you feel, it's better to come out with it.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: I didn't mean it.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Sure you did.  So come on.  Say what you think.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Waitress!  Four beers!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You don't wanna put beer over mai-tai.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: If you can't keep up, don't drink yours.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: We gotta face some facts here.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What facts are those?

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: I understand how it could happen.  I know why any guy would love her.  And I can't blame you that it happened.  You thought I was dead, she was grieving, you were trying to help her.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I was grieving too.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Yeah, right.  Anyway, you didn't know.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: So what are you saying?

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: I'm saying now you do know.  So it's time for you to fuck off.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You left her.  How's that for a fact?

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: How's this for a fact?  I loved her first.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: How come you're not pukin'?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I guess I'm used to it.  I've felt like throwing up every minute since you got back.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Don't blame her, Rafe.  It's not like you're thinking.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: She loves you.  I know that.  And part of what she loves in me is how much of you she sees in me.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: She said I was so much like you.  I said, No, I'm not.  I'm like I am because of you, but I'm not you, not as good as you. Everybody else saw me as a loser with a big chip on his shoulder.  But you saw the better part of me, the part of me that could be like you, and changed me. You made me who I am.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: How sweet.  Is that when you put the move on her?

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Get me into a plane!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Come on!

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Where are we going?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Auxiliary field at Haleiwa, ten miles north of here.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: What's there?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Six P-40's.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: This ain't a little feud, Earl, it's World War Two!

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: They're coming around for another pass. You got extra weapons and ammo?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: It's tight.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Tighter 'n a bulls ass in fly season. Don't hit the barn.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: They're all over us!

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Bet they don't dust crops in Japan.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: You hear my okay?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah.  So you can call me if you need help.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: I got a half a tank.  You?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Little less.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Land of the free.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Home of the brave.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: I'm out of ammo!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I'm out of fuel!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Sorry you're gonna die -- cause I'm gonna make it.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: What color flowers you want me to bring to your funeral?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Fun today.  Like old times.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Danny, what the hell are you trying to do out there?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What do you mean?  I'm just doing what we've always done.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: No.  You're trying to beat me.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: We've always tried to beat each other.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Bullshit.  We've played with each other, pushed each other.  This is different. Like you want to prove that you're better than me.  Who's that for -- Evelyn?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Maybe just trying to measure up.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: What's between you and her is between you and her.  But here's what's between you and me.  Everybody has a hero, Danny. And you're mine.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: It's shorter than our practice runway.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: They'll turn the ship into the wind before we launch.  That'll help.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: We'll be loaded with 2,000 pounds of bombs and 1,500 pounds of fuel.  I got another Chinese phrase for Doolittle. "Mug wump rickshaw mushu pork."  It means "Who the fuck thought up this shit?"

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: It's not getting any longer.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Longer?  It's getting shorter.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Broomsticks instead of tail guns.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: We'll get separated over the target, but you and I will rendezvous for the run to China.  I'm on your wing.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: And I'm on yours.  Land of the free.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Home of the Brave.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Danny...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I can't make it.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Yes you can.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Hey!  What is this, the planes all bunched up like that?

turns.speaker: MECHANIC
turns.text: The brass is afraid of sabotage.  This makes 'em easier to protect -- and easier to service.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What about easier to hit in an air raid?

turns.speaker: MECHANIC
turns.text: Who's gonna to that?  Japan is four thousand miles away.  So you guys just arrived, huh?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MECHANIC
turns.text: We got a saying here.  A-low-HA!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Lieutenant... I'm Danny Walker.  I'm Rafe McCawley's best friend.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Were.  Isn't that what you mean?  Were. Because he's dead, isn't he?  And that's why you've come.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Before Rafe left, he asked me to be the one to tell you, if it happened.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: He told me about you.  That he had no other friend like you.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Rafe's folks had a crop dusting business, owned their own planes.  Real straight, frugal.  My father was the town drunk. Went to sleep one night on the railroad tracks and was still there when the Dawn Express came along.  Rafe and I were the only ones at the funeral.  He took me back to his house, and I never left.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You were more like brothers.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I taught him to drink beer.  He taught me how to fly.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: He said you're the only one he ever saw who was better in the air than him.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: ...He said that?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: How's everything?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: We got some soldiers in traction from a jeep accident, but it's quiet.  Except for the occasional fighter plane buzzing us.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: That might not have been such a good idea.  They're making us fly out of a half-paved airfield.  The real punishment is that I won't be back to the barracks till it's too late for dinner or coffee. So I guess it's goodbye for awhile.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I was just thinking that war is a series of goodbyes.  Do you think that's why we're meeting.  To help us say goodbye to Rafe?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I swore not to talk about him tonight, but there's all this stuff I think I ought to tell you, that he didn't get a chance to.  Rafe was...he was lonely.  He had such high expectations of himself that he always felt empty.  The week he met you he told me he felt his heart had always lived in winter, and for the first time in his life he has seen the spring.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: He told me he didn't want to leave me with regret.  Now that's all I have.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Hey, have you seen Pearl Harbor at night?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Well...sure.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: From the air?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: So beautiful!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Hang on.

turns.speaker: RED
turns.text: And where's the secret base, Sir?  The one we t-takeoff from.

turns.speaker: DOOLITTLE
turns.text: The navy will get us to within 400 miles of the Japanese coast.  We'll launch off the carriers from there.

turns.speaker: RED
turns.text: C-Colonel, we been p-practicing takeoff's, but I ain't sure we can land on these carriers d-decks.

turns.speaker: DOOLITTLE
turns.text: We won't have the fuel to get back to the carriers; they'll turn and run back to Hawaii the minute we're airborne.

turns.speaker: RED
turns.text: Then wh-where do we land?

turns.speaker: DOOLITTLE
turns.text: I have a phrase I want you all to memorize:  "Lushu hoo megwa fugi."  It means "I am an American."  In Chinese.

turns.speaker: DOOLITTLE
turns.text: Now we have fifteen requests for the Emperor's Palace...and one for Tokyo baseball stadium.

turns.speaker: RED
turns.text: I d-don't think Japs ought'a be allowed to p-play baseball.

turns.speaker: DOOLITTLE
turns.text: I'd like to bomb their Emperor too.  But I think that'd just piss 'em off.  The idea here, Gentlemen, is not revenge. We're here to prove to them that they're neither invincible nor superior.  So let's try this again.  Military targets only.

turns.speaker: RED
turns.text: Colonel, to f-fight you need strategy. To have strategy, ya gotta practice.  And to practice it, ya gotta play --

turns.speaker: DOOLITTLE
turns.text: No baseball diamonds, Red.

turns.speaker: RED
turns.text: Y-Yes Sir.

turns.speaker: DOOLITTLE
turns.text: There are some people who think the outside loop is reckless and irresponsible.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: How could it be irresponsible, Sir, if you were the first man in the world to do it?

turns.speaker: DOOLITTLE
turns.text: Don't get smart with me, son.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Never, Sir.  I just meant it's dangerous only for the kind of pilot who wants to show off, rather than inspire the other pilots in his unit.  And all you've done for me, Sir, working out the transfer, I did it to say thanks.  To honor you, Sir. What the French call a "homage."

turns.speaker: DOOLITTLE
turns.text: That's bullshit, son.  But it's really good bullshit.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Thank you, Sir.

turns.speaker: DOOLITTLE
turns.text: Good luck over there McCawley.  I admire your decision.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Thank you, Sir.

turns.speaker: DOOLITTLE
turns.text: I heard what you did.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: We can explain, Colonel.

turns.speaker: DOOLITTLE
turns.text: Explain what?

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Is that the good new, Sir, or --

turns.speaker: DOOLITTLE
turns.text: You're just about the only pilots in the Army with actual combat experience, so you're volunteering for a mission I've been ordered to put together.  Do you know what top secret is?

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Well sure, Colonel --

turns.speaker: DOOLITTLE
turns.text: Top secret means you help me pick the other pilots, train, and go -- without knowing where you're going until it's too late.

turns.speaker: DOOLITTLE
turns.text: In flight school you qualified in single and in multi-engine planes.  You'll be flying multi-engines here.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Bombers.

turns.speaker: DOOLITTLE
turns.text: I want to introduce a couple of people. Doc White is a flight surgeon; he has volunteered for gunnery training so that he can go on the mission, because we can't spare the weight of an extra man.

turns.speaker: DOOLITTLE
turns.text: I thought I'd made it clear, I'm not just putting this mission together -- I'm leading it myself.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: I take it back, about the flowers.  We're all gonna die.

turns.speaker: DOOLITTLE
turns.text: Listen you guys.  I'm the first plane -- then McCawley, Walker, the rest of you. I'll have the shortest run.  If I don't make it, you don't go.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Colonel...we're all going.  Whether you make it or not.

turns.speaker: DOOLITTLE
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: DORIE
turns.text: 'Scuse me, 'Mam.  All the ship's doctors is golfing, and I couldn't find nobody to look at this.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Our doctor's gone too.

turns.speaker: DORIE
turns.text: Sorry to trouble you.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Wait, let me look at that... You better come in here.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: How'd you get this?

turns.speaker: DORIE
turns.text: Boxin'.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Win?

turns.speaker: DORIE
turns.text: Yes'm.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: DORIE
turns.text: Dorie Miller, 'Mam.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I'm Evelyn.  And I'm just a nurse.  But I'm not playing golf, and that cut needs sewing, or else it's gonna make a big lumpy scar.  Whatta ya say?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: How often you fight like this?

turns.speaker: DORIE
turns.text: Every other Sunday.  I'm heavyweight champion of the West Virginia.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What do you get for winning?

turns.speaker: DORIE
turns.text: Respect.

turns.speaker: DORIE
turns.text: Thank you, 'Mam.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Tell me something, Dorie.  A man as big as you -- and smart too, you knew where to come when your ship couldn't help -- do you still have to fight with your fists to get respect?

turns.speaker: DORIE
turns.text: I left my Mama and joined the Navy to be a man.  They made me a cook -- and not even that, really -- I clean up after the other sailors eat.  I shine the officer's shoes.  In two years, they've never even let me fire a gun.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You take care, Dorie.

turns.speaker: DORIE
turns.text: You too, 'Mam.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Hello, Lieutenant.  Good to see you.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You too, Lieutenant.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Oh, this is Betty.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Nice to meet you, Betty.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Danny's not coming?

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: No, he...got some news today.  He'll be okay, he just didn't feel like coming tonight.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I was hoping to meet him.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Whatever you're trying to tell me isn't good, is it.  Or it wouldn't be so hard to say.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: The only reason it's hard to say is that I keep thinking I don't have the right to say it.  But I've got to because it's true.  I love you.  That must surprise you.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: It surprises me that I'm not the only one on this balcony who feels that way.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: There's one thing I have to say.  I'm going away.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: We're all going away.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: I'm going to the war.  The real war. Hitler's taken Europe.  The Brits are hanging on by their fingernails, and If they lose, there'll be more people killed than anybody can imagine.  And not just there, but here.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: But you're in the U.S. Army, how could you --

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Colonel Doolittle pulled the strings, and put me on loan to the R.A.F.  They need pilots, and we need experience.  I leave tomorrow.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You waited til tonight to tell me?

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: I had to tell you in person.  Because there's something else I need to say.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Evelyn...you know the line -- let's make tonight memorable.  What I feel about you makes it impossible for me to say something like that.  If I don't come back, I don't want to saddle you with regret and sadness you'll carry the rest of your life.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I don't know if you can choose that, Rafe.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Maybe not.  But I need you to know.  I love you.  And I will come back.  I'll find a way.  And then we'll get a chance to know if what I felt the first moment I saw you, and every minute since then, is real.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Do one thing for me, before you go.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: I sent telegrams, I guess the military traffic held them up.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Why were you sitting here, instead of...

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: I saw you, I couldn't go in, I...just stood there wondering if you knew.  You looked...sad, and I had to sit down a minute.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: How did you?...

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: ...Survive?  I jumped in a patch of fog, and nobody could see me.  I hit the water hard.  And it was so...cold.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: I called my folks, then Colonel Doolittle.  The Colonel sent a man to pick me up.  They wanted to debrief me. I told the Colonel I needed to see somebody first, and he had a supply flight heading out in an hour.  I've done a lot of talking.  You haven't said anything.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I'm just...so amazed, so glad to know that you're okay.  You are okay, aren't you?

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Nothing that won't heal.  I guess.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: It's been...so different, being so sure you were dead.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: I'm so sorry for what you must've gone through, but I'm back.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: It's all right.  Danny always said I see things with my emotions instead of my eyes.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: It's not your fault, Rafe.  The letter I wrote you, they --

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Don't worry about that.  Guys away from home, lonely, good-hearted women try to cheer them up.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: It's not that I didn't mean everything I wrote.  It's just that -- I thought you were dead.  And now --

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: What else can we do?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: There's nothing you can do here, they'll die or they won't, we just --

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Rafe --

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: I need to tell you something.  I didn't know what it was to lose somebody, to see death and find how much it scares you. That you haven't lived and loved enough. I didn't understand.  Forgive me.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Rafe... No.  You forgive me.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: Of course I forgive you.  I know what you feel for Danny is real.  And your choice is your choice.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: That's what I have to tell you, Rafe.  It wasn't a choice.  It --

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: What?...

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: They were bringing back a ship full of wounded and needed extra nurses along.  I wrote Colonel Doolittle, and told him I needed to see you before you go.

turns.speaker: RAFE
turns.text: It must of been a convincing letter.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: It was.  I couldn't have you go away, wherever it is...to war...without knowing something.  You think I made a choice, of Danny over you.  I didn't.  I didn't have a choice.  I'm pregnant.

turns.speaker: YAMAMOTO
turns.text: Uncharged torpedoes have different balance.

turns.speaker: GENDA
turns.text: I have arranged a live fire drill -- with your permission.

turns.speaker: YAMAMOTO
turns.text: Everything real except the fact that no one is shooting back at us.

turns.speaker: GENDA
turns.text: If we achieve surprise, they will offer little resistance.

turns.speaker: YAMAMOTO
turns.text: Set up teams of radio operators to send out messages the Americans will intercept, concerning every potential American target in the Pacific.  Include Hawaii -- the clutter will be more confusing that way.

turns.speaker: GENDA
turns.text: Brilliant, Admiral.

turns.speaker: YAMAMOTO
turns.text: A brilliant man would find a way not to fight a war.
